description: Do you want to create an application but lack the necessary skills and expertise to make that possible? This course teaches you how to create two types of Android apps: a business app and a free form tasks app using App Inventor 2. You'll explore all the stages, from designing a basic home screen layout with the ‘designer’ editor to implementing various functionality using the ‘block’ editor and publishing the apps.

courseDescription:
If you want to become an app developer but are intimidated by the thought of programming since you have no experience with coding or technology, this course is for you. You will be taken step by step through creating your valuable app. It begins by introducing the process of developing an Android business application. You'll learn how to build the home screen and navigation bar layouts with components like Activity Starter, PhoneCall and TextBox and how to add distinctive functions to your application with the ‘blocks’ section.

Then you will learn how to create and implement the main screen of the form task list using components like ListView and ListPicker to display your list items and receive user input. Following that, you will discover how to pass data between screens, add tasks to file, delete the list, toggle filter bar and main image, cancel tasks, show new tasks first and make them attractive by using and arranging certain built-in blocks in a specific way.

Next, the course discusses the Google Play Market, Google Play Developer Account and Google Play Console. Then you'll find out how to create a Google Play account and a Google Play Developer account in just a few steps and understand the distinctions between them. Next, we will demonstrate a variety of application graphic assets such as screenshots, high-resolution icons and feature graphics. Finally, you will learn how to upload and publish your Android applications to the Google Play Store and how to update your ready-to-use app.
